other_tests.findings: Weight was 69.2 kg, height 177.8 cm, arm span 188 cm, ratio of arm span to height 1.06, and ratio of upper to lower body segment 0.87. Pectus excavatum of the upper chest and pectus carinatum of the lower chest were seen, with broad thumbs, and no evidence of joint hypermobility.

other_tests.date: At 13 years of age to 16 years of age
other_tests.findings: Increased myopia of 12.75 diopters in the right eye and 11.00 diopters in the left eye. At 9 months before this evaluation, manifest refraction was -13.75 diopters in the right eye and -10.00 diopters in the left eye.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Over 4 years, notable increase in myopia was observed.

other_tests.findings: Right eye refracted to -14.50 diopters and left eye to -11.00 diopters. Visual acuity was 20/20 in both eyes with glasses. Anterior chambers were shallow.
Findings consistent with microspherophakia with lens diameters of 8.41 mm in the right eye and 8.03 mm in the left eye.
Abnormally low bone mineral density of 0.75 g/cm² averaged over vertebral bodies L1 through L4, resulting in a z score of -2.7.
Pyridoxine decreased homocysteine levels to 64 μmol/L after a 500 mg dose, followed by 15.8 μmol/L after 2 weeks.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Initial levels were significantly reduced, indicating responsiveness to treatment.

other_tests.procedure_name: Surgery for Lens Removal and Intraocular Lens Implants
other_tests.findings: Surgical removal of both lenses and insertion of anterior chamber intraocular lens implants performed due to episodes of subacute angle-closure glaucoma.
